page.title: 01Gazeteer,Sherburn-in-Elmet.
page.content: {A Gazeteer of Sherburn In Elmet.} Sherburn In Elmet is a thriving village in North Yorkshire, situated at the southern end of the Vale of York.It was once the eastern capital of the ancient Brigantine Kingdom of Elmete, and the 16th. century church and the 17th. century old gabled Hungate School are particularly worthy of note.The village has developed round the crossroads where the A162 from Ferrybridge to Tadcaster and the B1222 from Leeds to York meet.It was on the ancient route between Pontefract and York castles which avoided crossing the nearby fens.It is just 13 miles from Leeds,13 miles from York,5 miles from Tadcaster and 9 miles from Selby.It owes its rapid development in recent years to the nearby Selby Coalfield and the expansion of the local trading estate.
